rules: Rule1: If the curator has approval for the exhibition plan, then the exhibition opens successfully.
Rule2: If the setup crew encounters delays with the antique furniture, then the director authorizes overtime for the setup crew.
Rule3: Either the setup crew encounters delays with the antique furniture or the conservator discovers damage to the display cabinets.
Rule4: If the conservator discovers damage to the display cabinets, then the director authorizes overtime for the setup crew.
Rule5: If the media team installs interactive touchscreen tools, then the technician completes lighting in the gallery space.
Rule6: If the designer arranges furniture in the gallery space, then the exhibition opens successfully.
Rule7: If the project manager coordinates teams, then the media team installs interactive touchscreen tools.
Rule8: If the senior designer supervises installation, then the designer arranges furniture in the gallery space.
Rule9: Either the project manager holds a meeting with team leads or the senior designer conducts a walkthrough of the gallery space.
Rule10: If the senior designer conducts a walkthrough of the gallery space, then the senior designer supervises installation.
Rule11: If the curator submits a request to the director, then the curator has approval for the exhibition plan.
Rule12: Either the curator submits a request to the director or the curator presents a proposal to the board.
Rule13: If the public receives a complaint about accessibility, then the exhibition does not miss its opening.
Rule14: Either the public receives a complaint about accessibility or the inspector identifies safety hazards.
Rule15: If the inspector identifies safety hazards, then the exhibition does not miss its opening.
Rule16: If the curator secures insurance for the exhibition items, then the curator has approval for the exhibition plan.
Rule17: If the insurance agent confirms coverage for the exhibition items, then the curator secures insurance for the exhibition items.
Rule18: If the legal advisor reviews terms of the loan agreement, then the director approves the loan agreement contract.
Rule19: Either the legal advisor reviews terms of the loan agreement or the curator negotiates terms with lenders.
Rule20: If the curator negotiates terms with lenders, then the curator signing contracts with lenders leads to the curator having approval for the exhibition plan.
Rule21: If the director approves the loan agreement contract, then the curator signing contracts with lenders causes the curator to have approval for the exhibition plan.
Rule22: If the curator presents a proposal to the board, then the curator completes documentation for the exhibition plan.
Rule23: If the curator completes documentation for the exhibition plan, then the curator obtains funding for the exhibition budget.
Rule24: If the curator obtains funding for the exhibition budget, then the insurance agent confirms coverage for the exhibition items.
Rule25: If the curator obtains funding for the exhibition budget, then the curator signs contracts with lenders.
Rule26: If the security head verifies compliance with the exhibition plan, then the curator obtaining funding for the exhibition budget results in the curator having approval for the exhibition plan.
Rule27: If the director authorizes overtime for the setup crew, then the director extending the deadline for the setup period leads to the director not canceling the exhibition.
Rule28: If the project manager holding a meeting with team leads does not result in the project manager coordinating teams, then the exhibition misses its opening.
Rule29: If the exhibition does not open successfully, then the director cancels the exhibition.
facts: Fact1: The security head verifies compliance with the exhibition plan.
Fact2: The director extends the deadline for the setup period.
Fact3: The technician does not complete lighting in the gallery space.
